variant.subsectionHeader: INVITED SPEAKER George Miller Dictionaries of the Mind The Use of Syntactic Clues in Discourse Understanding Nan Decker Grammar Viewed as a Functioning Part of a Cognitive System
variant.sectionHeader: ANNOUNCEMENTS STUDIES IN NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING
variant.bodyText: Two volumes in the Cambridge University Press series have just been published:
variant.listItem: • Natural Language Parsing — Psychological, Computa- tional, and Theoretical Perspectives edited by David Dowty, Lauri Karttunen, and Arnold Zwicky $39.60 members ($49.50 nonmembers); • Generating Natural Language by Kathleen McKeown $23.96 ($29.95). One is to be published by midsummer: • Planning Natural Language Utterances, by Douglas Appelt. Three are in production: • Space and Prepositions in English by Annette Herskovits; • An Introduction to Computational Linguistics by Ralph Grishman; • Semantic Interpretation Against Ambiguity by Graeme Hirst.
variant.bodyText: Three volumes are currently under review. Books should be ordered directly from Cambridge University Press. To qualify for the 20% discount, iden- tify yourself as an ACL member. From the U.S. and Canada contact:
variant.table: Cambridge University Press 32 East 57th Street New York, NY 10022 from elsewhere: Cambridge University Press The Edinburgh Building Shaftesbury Road Cambridge, CB2 2RU, ENGLAND Manuscripts and editorial inquiries should be sent to Aravind Joshi Computer and Information Science University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA 19104 phone 215:898-8540 csnet joshi@upenn. NOMINATIONS FOR 1986 ACL SLATE
variant.bodyText: The Nominating Committee has submitted the following slate for consideration during the 23rd ACL Annual Meeting (8-12 July 1985, University of Chicago):
variant.figure: President Ralph M. Weischedel, Bolt Beranek and Newman Inc. Vice President William C. Mann, USC/ Information Systems Institute Secretary-Treasurer Donald E. Walker, Bell Communications Research Executive Committee (1986-1988) Barbara Grosz, SRI International Nominating Committee (1986-1988) Madeleine Bates, Bolt Beranek and Newman Inc.
variant.bodyText: The election will take place during the Business Meeting, to be on held at 17:30 on 10 July 1985. Additional nominations can be proposed at that meeting, but nomi- nators must be able to guarantee that their candidates are willing to serve if elected.
The two ACL Sessions at NCC '85 in Chicago, sched- uled to follow one another on the afternoon of July 15, 1985, are:
variant.author: Session Chair: Martha Evens
variant.subsectionHeader: How to Get a Big Natural Language System on a Personal Computer
variant.bodyText: Bozena and Frederick Thompson, California Institute of Technology
variant.subsectionHeader: Categorizing Natural Language Queries for Intelligent Responses
variant.reference: Kurt Godden, General Motors Research Laboratories CLOUT — A Natural Language Program for Microcomput- ers Wayne Erickson, Microrim, Inc.
variant.table: The FINITE STRING Newsletter Announcements COMPUTER TEXT GENERATION — COMMUNICATING IN ENGLISH Session Chair: Kathleen McKeown Columbia University The Need for Text Generation Kathleen McKeown, Columbia University Knowledge Needed for Expert System Explanation Bill Swartout, USC/ Information Sciences Institute Planning and Language Generation in Problem-solving Systems Douglas Appelt, SRI International
variant.tableCaption: Surface Generation for a Variety of Applications
variant.sectionHeader: NEW OXFORD ENGLISH DICTIONAKY RESEARCH FELLOWSHIPS
variant.bodyText: The University of Waterloo Centre for the New Oxford English Dictionary has just been established as a unit for study in the areas of text database management and applied and theoretical research in lexicology. Fellow- ships are available for research relating to applied or theoretical issues in lexicology, commercial applications, or dictionary-based research. Requests for information should be directed to The Administrative Director The UW Centre for the New OED
variant.reference: University of Waterloo Waterloo, Ontario, CANADA N2L 3G1 PEOPLE ON THE MOVE Dr. Yorick Wilks is now the director of, and a professor of computer science at, the Computing Research Laboratory Rio Grande Research Corridor New Mexico State University Las Cruces, NM 88003 (505) 646-5466 csnet: yorick@nmsu Computational Linguistics, Volume 11, Number I, January-March 1985 47
